UserFolder package

Submodules

UserFolder.ctkdialog module

UserFolder.dialog module

Module contents

This is a simple library that allows you to read, write and create files within your own folder inside the user folder (C:/User/USER/.python/PACKAGE_ID)

class UserFolder.Cache(id: str = None, user: User = None, root_path: str = None)[source]

Bases: object

add_directory(*path: str, rewrite: bool = False) → Self[source]

Add all files in directory to cache

Parameters:

  • path (str) – The directory to cache

  • rewrite (bool, optional) – When true it will re-cache this directory even if its already cached, defaults to False

Return type:

Cache

register_item(key: str, default=None, datatype=None, title: str = None, description: str = None, from_: float = None, to: float = None) → Self[source]

Sets the value of the pair identified by key to value, creating a new key/value pair if none existed for key previously

Parameters:

  • key (str) – The key to set

  • default (_type_, optional) – The fallback value to use, defaults to None

  • datatype (_type_, optional) – The datatype to use for this value, defaults to None

  • title (str, optional) – Title of this option, defaults to None

  • description (str, optional) – Description about this option, defaults to None

  • from (float, optional) – The minimum allowed value, defaults to None

  • to (float, optional) – The maximum allowed value, defaults to None

Return type:

Config

class UserFolder.User(id: str = None, setupcommand=None, path: str = None)[source]

Bases: object

copy(src: str, dst: str, delete_src: bool = False, delete_files: bool = False) → Self[source]

Copy a file or directory from src to dst

Parameters:

  • src (str) – The source path to copy

  • dst (str) – The destination path to paste the source path

  • delete_src (bool, optional) – When true it will delete the source path, defaults to False

  • delete_files (bool, optional) – Delete all files in directory. (Can only delete empty directories), defaults to False

Return type:

User

download(package: str, filename: str = None, trackcommand=None, thread: bool = False) → Response[source]

Download file from the web. If request returns status code ‘404’ it will not download the file

Parameters:

  • package (str) – The URL to the package to download

  • filename (str, optional) – The filename of the package, defaults to None

  • trackcommand (Function, optional) – The callback command for downloading the file, defaults to None

  • thread (bool, optional) – If true it will run in a new thread, defaults to False

Returns:

Response from the download

Return type:

requests.Response

Returns a list of all files that are in the scripts users folder

Return type:

open(file: str, mode: str = 'r') → TextIOWrapper[source]

Opens the file that is in the scripts user folder

Parameters:

  • file (str) – A list of each folder in path

  • mode (str, optional) – The mode to open this file in, defaults to ‘r’

Returns:

The contents of the file

Return type:

TextIOWrapper

Character Meaning —

‘r’ open for reading (default)

‘w’ open for writing, truncating the file first

‘x’ create a new file and open it for writing

‘a’ open for writing, appending to the end of the file if it exists

‘b’ binary mode

‘t’ text mode (default)

‘+’ open a disk file for updating (reading and writing)

‘U’ universal newline mode (deprecated)

remove(path: str, delete_files: bool = False) → Self[source]

Removes a directory or a file from the UserFolder

Parameters:

  • path (str) – The file or directory to delete

  • delete_files (bool, optional) – Delete all files in directory. (Can only delete empty directories), defaults to False

Return type:

User

show(*paths: str) → bool[source]

Opens the file in your devices default editor. If filename is undefined it will open the scripts user folder

Parameters:

paths (str) – A list of each folder in path

Returns:

true - successfully showed the file or folder, false - failed to show file or folder

Return type:

bool

unarchive(src: str, dst: str = None, members: list = None, format: str = None, deletesrc: bool = True, trackcommand=None, thread: bool = False) → bool[source]

Unarchive a zip or gz file. It’s recomended to call this method in a thread

Parameters:

  • src (str) – The path to the archive

  • dst (str, optional) – The destination to drop the unarchived folders, defaults to None

  • members (list, optional) – The members to unarchive. Will otherwise extract all members, defaults to None

  • format (str, optional) – The archive format. ‘zip’ or ‘gz’, defaults to None

  • deletesrc (bool, optional) – Delete the orgional source file after it is done unarchiving, defaults to True

  • trackcommand (_type_, optional) – The callback command for every member in archive, defaults to None

  • thread (bool, optional) – If true it will run in a new thread, defaults to False

Returns:

true - successfully unarchived package, false - failed to unarchive package

Return type:

bool

uninstall() → bool[source]

Will delete the scripts user folder

Returns:

true - successfully deleted the scripts user folder, false - failed to delete scripts user folder (A file is still being prossessed)

Return type:

bool
